game_config.name: Game Configuration
game_config.desc: Choose the options below that apply to you. This allows the customizer to make sure the pack works properly with your game.

overworld_sky.name: Overworld Sky
overworld_sky.desc: Some mods, like Optifine, let resource packs customize how the sky is drawn. Post-processing shaders allow Dokucraft to draw a custom sky without requiring any mods.

screen_effects.name: Screen Effects
screen_effects.desc: Buffs and debuffs, also known as mob effects, usually only add a small icon in the corner of your screen to tell you that you are affected by them. The options below try to improve immersion by changing certain effects to add a custom effect to the screen while you are affected by them.

post.name: I use the Fabulous graphics setting
post.desc: Fabulous enables post-processing shaders, which can be used by resource packs to do some things that can't be done with Fast or Fancy.

optifine.name: I use Optifine
optifine.desc: Optifine allows resource packs to do a lot of things that are not possible in the vanilla game.

shaderpack.name: I use a shaderpack with Optifine or Iris
shaderpack.desc: Shaderpacks can change a lot about how the game is rendered which can cause problems with some assets or effects.

sodium.name: I use Sodium
sodium.desc: Sodium disables some of the shaders in resource packs that allow the pack to create certain effects.

better_lava.name: Better Lava
better_lava.desc: Improve the look of lava by adding random texture variants with procedurally generated animations.

of_custom_sky_overworld.name: Optifine Custom Sky
of_custom_sky_overworld.desc: Use Optifine's Custom Sky feature to draw a mostly static skybox in the overworld instead of requiring post-processing shaders.

night_sky.name: Night Sky
night_sky.desc: Use post-processing shaders to customize the night sky in vanilla Minecraft.
night_sky.incompatText: Requires Fabulous graphics and is incompatible with Sodium and OF Custom Sky

options.name: Procedural Night Sky
options.desc: Generate a night sky without using any textures.

night_sky_v2.name: Night Sky
night_sky_v2.desc: Use post-processing shaders to customize the night sky in vanilla Minecraft.
night_sky_v2.incompatText: Requires Fabulous graphics, is incompatible with Sodium and OF Custom Sky, and is overridden by Fabulous Firmament

options.name: Procedural Night Sky
options.desc: Generate a night sky without using any textures.

options.name: Moonlit Fog
options.desc: Same as the Procedural Night Sky, but also changes the moon to be much bigger and adds a light layer of fog that is dynamically lit up by the moon based on where the moon is and what phase it's in.

auroras.name: Auroras
auroras.incompatText: Requires Fabulous graphics and is incompatible with Sodium, shaderpacks, and OF Custom Sky

aurora_color.name: Aurora Color
aurora_color.desc: Choose a color for the auroras.

end_sky.name: End Sky
end_sky.desc: In vanilla Minecraft, the End sky uses a skybox with a tiling texture. Resource packs can change the texture used for this or, with Optifine or core shaders, override how the skybox is drawn entirely.

options.name: Vanilla
options.desc: Use the tiling vanilla End skybox with a custom texture.

options.name: Optifine
options.desc: Use Optifine's Custom Sky feature to replace the skybox.

options.name: Otherworldy Rift
options.desc: Use core shaders to replace the skybox with an animated rift into another world.

options.name: Cloudy
options.desc: Use core shaders to replace the skybox with stars and animated clouds.

end_sky_rift_color.name: Rift Color
end_sky_rift_color.desc: Choose a color for the glow from the Otherworldly Rift.

end_sky_rift_os_color.name: Outside The Rift - Star Color
end_sky_rift_os_color.desc: Choose a color for the stars outside the Otherworldly Rift.

end_sky_rift_on_color.name: Outside The Rift - Nebulae Color
end_sky_rift_on_color.desc: Choose a color for the nebulae outside the Otherworldly Rift.

end_sky_rift_is_color.name: Inside The Rift - Star Color
end_sky_rift_is_color.desc: Choose a color for the stars inside the Otherworldly Rift.

end_sky_rift_in_color.name: Inside The Rift - Nebulae Color
end_sky_rift_in_color.desc: Choose a color for the nebulae inside the Otherworldly Rift.

end_sky_cloudy_base_color.name: Cloudy Sky - Base Color
end_sky_cloudy_base_color.desc: Choose a base color for the Cloudy sky.

end_sky_cloudy_primary_color.name: Cloudy Sky - Primary Color
end_sky_cloudy_primary_color.desc: Choose a color for the primary clouds in the Cloudy sky.

end_sky_cloudy_primary_fade_color_1.name: Cloudy Sky - Primary Fade Color 1
end_sky_cloudy_primary_fade_color_1.desc: Choose a color for the primary clouds where they fade out in the Cloudy sky.

end_sky_cloudy_primary_fade_color_2.name: Cloudy Sky - Primary Fade Color 2
end_sky_cloudy_primary_fade_color_2.desc: Choose a secondary color for the primary clouds where they fade out in the Cloudy sky.

end_sky_cloudy_secondary_color.name: Cloudy Sky - Secondary Color
end_sky_cloudy_secondary_color.desc: Choose a color for the secondary clouds in the Cloudy sky.

end_sky_cloudy_star_color.name: Cloudy Sky - Star Color
end_sky_cloudy_star_color.desc: Choose a color for the stars in the Cloudy sky.

campfire_color.name: Campfire Color
campfire_color.desc: Choose a color for your campfires.

soul_campfire_color.name: Soul Campfire Color
soul_campfire_color.desc: Choose a color for your soul campfires.

leaves_model.name: Leaves Model
leaves_model.desc: Choose a model for the leaves blocks.

options.name: Vanilla
options.desc: Use the standard simple block model.

options.name: Bushy leaves
options.desc: Leaves blocks have some leaves that stick out to give them a bushy look.

waving_plants.name: Waving Plants
waving_plants.desc: Dokucraft can use core shaders to make things like vegitation less static. This option makes plants wave slightly, as if the wind was pushing them around.

swinging_lanterns.name: Swinging Lanterns
swinging_lanterns.desc: Core shaders can be used to make hanging lanterns swing back and forth, as if they were lightly pushed by the wind.

flip_shovels.name: Shovel Rotation
flip_shovels.desc: Choose how shovels should be displayed.

options.name: Left
options.desc: Shovels point forwards when held to match the animation when used.

options.name: Right
options.desc: Shovels point upwards when held to match other tools.

fresnel.name: Fresnel Effect
fresnel.desc:
In vanilla Minecraft, water and other translucent surfaces always have the same amount of transparency as their texture. While that seems to make a lot of sense, it has some downsides in-game and it is not how, for example, water looks in real life. It is harder to see through real water surfaces when viewed from shallow angles because of the Fresnel effect, which makes the amount of reflectance of a surface depend on the viewing angle.

This option tries to emulate the Fresnel effect by making translucent materials more opaque when viewed from shallow angles. This means that when you look out towards the horizon over the ocean from a beach, the water at the horizon will be a lot more opaque than the water at your feet. When viewed from straight above, there will not be much difference. This helps to hide the ugly edges of the world that you can easily see through the water normally.

glass_panes.name: Glass Panes
glass_panes.desc: Choose a look for all glass panes.

options.name: Decorated
options.desc: Glass panes have fancy patterns to make them different from the glass blocks.

options.name: Clear
options.desc: Glass panes use the same texture as regular glass blocks.

inset_doors.name: Inset Doors
inset_doors.desc: Move doors slightly into their frame so they are not perfectly flush with the wall.

post_sun.name: Animated Sun
post_sun.desc: Animate the sun and draw it as part of the skybox to improve the blending with the sky.

fabulous_firmament.name: Fabulous Firmament
fabulous_firmament.desc:
Replaces the overworld sky with one that has clouds that are dynamically lit by the sun and moon. These clouds are on a separate layer, obstructing the sun and moon instead of being behind them, and they stay visible even at night.

This option overrides the Animated Sun and Night Sky options, enabling the animated sun and the Moonlit Fog night sky. If enabled, the auroras will also light up the clouds from behind.

darkness_effect.name: Darkness Effect
darkness_effect.desc: Adds a subtle whispy effect around the screen while you have the darkness effect.

wither_effect.name: Wither Effect
wither_effect.desc: Adds a pulsing effect around the screen while you have the wither effect.

speed_effect.name: Speed Effect
speed_effect.desc: Adds speed lines around the screen while you have the speed effect.
